content.description: Fun route/variation on "Shloppy". This 4 ft straight dyno in the middle of the wall feels great when you get it, but can be a challenge both mentally and physically.
content.protection: A pad or 2 and probably a spotter
content.location: Start on the same hold as "Shloppy". Reach up slightly right to a good hold. Dyno to a big jug. Finish as per "Shloppy".

content.description: Probably the easiest climb in the park and the best problem to start a beginner with. Start on the far right side with hands on the horn, traverse left until you have both feet on the 'platform', using great jugs for the first 80% before finishing with smaller crimps and side pulls.
Sit start at the back of the overhang on the obvious jug. Climb straight up and over the lip to a good jug , once here head up right to top out.
content.location: 50ft from the Greenwich entrance parking lot.

content.description: Start on the far left side of the boulder with both hands on a solid very good horizontal chalked up flake.  Traverse directly right from the vertical holds to a right hand crimp.  Left hand goes high over the horizontal start holds located in a white seam.  Right hand throws for a 3 fingered crimp in same 45 degree white seam.  Reach out left for an obvious good hold around a corner.  Right hand follows the same corner line on to another solid hold.  Reach for the obvious prow outcropping.  The outcropping to the right is juggy and not dirty.  Beware to the left the climb is dirty.  Highball scramble to the top.
content.location: Right at the entrance of the Greenwich parking lot on the left.

content.description: Same sit start as Shloppy, go up further to the right of Shloppy with a laid back gaston up to the big jugs on the right.

Same start as Shloppy: sit start on the obvious jugs in the middle of the east face. Traverse up and to the right above the rock ledge (which is off of course), and around the corner. Finish is two hands on the rock wedge marked in the pic. Finish is a bit arbitrary; there are probably better lines to replace this with, but this is what I personally did.
content.protection: One pad near the finish; I don't think the early part of the traverse even really needs protection.

content.description: Start on crescent shaped dishes with a right foot below and a left foot flagged out. Right hand to a rail around the corner. Left hand to a crimp rail just beyond the left arete. Top out toward the mossy side.
content.location: Located at the Entrance Outcropping. Furthest boulder to the left, when looking from the trail.

content.description: In the parking lot on the Greenwich side is a nice outcropping of granite and schist.
